title: Aural set, Sextet No 1 - motion between lines

content.description: You will hear an excerpt consisting of two long phrases from a string sextet. Before listening to each section for the first time, please read the questions.
content.question:
Phases one and two:

Phases three and four:

In the first half of phrases three and four, the motion between the highest and lowest lines is best represented as

choices.label: Two slopes start from the left top and end at the right middle. Both are parallel to each other.
Two slopes start from the left bottom and end at the right middle. Both are parallel to each other.
The first slope starts from the left bottom and ends at the right middle. The second line starts from the left top and ends at the right middle.
The first slope starts from the left middle and ends at the right top. The second line starts from the left middle and ends at the right bottom.

content.answer: The first slope starts from the left middle and ends at the right top. The second line starts from the left middle and ends at the right bottom.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Use symbols and terms to describe melodic, harmonic, and rhythmic relationships in performed music. (This skill is applied in describing these elements in a full musical context.)
